intro: Xanthoxerampellia, commonly known as the golden-leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green foliage and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Xanthoxerampellia thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
